intro: Bulbinella latifolia subsp. toximontana, commonly known as the broad-leaved bulbinella, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous roots and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific conditions to flourish.
